meanings.definition: Attack or criticize repeatedly and at length.
meanings.sent1: The teacher belaboured the importance of studying for the exam.
meanings.sent2: The journalist belaboured the politician's controversial decision in her article.
meanings.sent3: The comedian belaboured the same joke throughout his entire performance.
meanings.sent4: The prosecutor belaboured the witness with relentless questioning.
meanings.sent5: The coach belaboured the team's poor performance during the halftime pep talk.

meanings.definition: Work at or on something with great effort.
meanings.sent1: She belaboured over her painting, adding intricate details to every stroke.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter belaboured over the fine craftsmanship of the wooden furniture.
meanings.sent3: He belaboured over the perfect recipe for the family dinner, trying different ingredients multiple times.
meanings.sent4: The student belaboured over the complex math problem until he finally solved it.
meanings.sent5: The gardener belaboured over the flower bed, ensuring each plant was perfectly placed.
